content: Imagine you are Mary Poppins. In her style, write a letter to the Banks children offering advice on growing up.

Dear Jane and Michael,

Well, well, well, what do we have here? It seems as though you two are on the cusp of something rather marvelous—growing up! Now, I know that might sound like a daunting prospect, but fear not, for I am here to offer some sage advice, sprinkled with a dash of fun and a pinch of practicality. After all, being a supersized nanny does come with its perks, doesn't it?

First and foremost, remember that life is an adventure, much like our flights to the park or our trips to the pound shop. Each day brings new experiences, some exhilarating, others perhaps a bit more mundane, but all of them opportunities to learn and grow. So, approach each day with curiosity and enthusiasm, just as you would approach a brand new jar of supercalifragilisticexpialidocious.

Now, as you grow older, you'll find that responsibilities come knocking at your door, much like the East Wind did that faithful day. It's essential to tackle these responsibilities head-on, with a smile and a song, if possible. Remember, "In every task that must be done, there is an element of fun." So, whether it's tidying your room or helping around the house, try to find the joy in the simplest of chores. Trust me; a spotless room can be rather satisfying, especially when it's neat enough for the birds to perch on your windowsill without causing a mess.

Moreover, nurture your imagination and creativity. The world is full of wonder, and it's up to you to see it through the eyes of a child, even as you mature. Keep dreaming big, because dreams have a way of guiding us towards our passions and purposes. Who knows? Maybe one day, you'll soar higher than chimney pots and discover lands beyond your wildest imaginations.

Education is another cornerstone of growth. Books are your friends, filled with knowledge and tales from across the globe. Read widely and read often. Not only will it expand your mind, but it will also equip you with the tools to navigate life's challenges. And remember, learning doesn't stop when you leave school; it's a lifelong journey. So, keep those minds sharp and hungry for more.

Friendship is yet another treasure to cherish as you grow. Choose your friends wisely, for they will shape who you become. Surround yourself with those who uplift and support you, who share your values and encourage your dreams. And be that kind of friend in return. Loyalty, kindness, and honesty should be the foundation of any relationship.

Lastly, always remember to have faith in yourself. Believe in your abilities and trust your instincts. Life may throw curveballs, but with courage and determination, you can overcome any obstacle. And when doubt creeps in, just think back to all the times you've faced adversity and come out smiling—like that time you stood up to the park bully or when you learned to ride a bicycle without training wheels.

In conclusion, growing up is a beautiful journey filled with learning, laughter, and love. Embrace every moment, good and bad, for they all contribute to the person you're becoming. And always, always remember that a spoonful of sugar helps the medicine go down, whether that medicine is a difficult task or a challenging situation.

With all my love and a touch of magic,

Mary Poppins
